texts.text: After becoming the Lord Chamberlain's Men, we released three more plays.
Today's the premiere of the latest of them.
It takes me back to the play we performed in secret for Queen Elizabeth, Romeo and Juliet.
That's the play that got us the position of Lord Chamberlain's Men in the first place.
I wrote only tragedies for a while after that, so this time I wrote a comedy.
After the play, I go out and greet our expectant audience, and the theater breaks out in an ovation.
A play is complete only when it finally elicits a reaction from the audience.
Their cheers fill the theater, guiding our production, and giving the actors on stage confidence.
Thus the performance improves, and the audience grows more and more engrossed in our stories.
What kickstarts that cycle is the script at the base of it all.
There are times when a good script can make up for a lacking execution and performance, but there's no such thing as a good play without a good script.
Once there is a script, it is the job of the playwright to keep the whole troupe within the bounds of the story.
I've done this professionally for a while now, but premieres are one thing I'll never get used to.
I head back to the wing of the stage, the full seats of the theater causing me to smile from ear to ear.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good job out there.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Thanks.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Now you're conducting yourself like the great man you are. It's the least I expect from Tenbridge's best-selling author.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Take another look. My knees are jelly.
Olivia glance at my shivering knees.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, you weren't joking.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Premieres always make me nervous.
She looks back at me and gives me a reassuring smile.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think it's a fine thing. Never forget that humility.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Hey, Will! Leader!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes?
Strictly speaking, she's not the troupe leader anymore.
But that's what everyone in the troupe still calls her.
I always consult with her about my latest works, and we also plan out the production together.
And she's in charge of the rehearsals and the logistics of it all.
She's also the one who whips us all into shape.
While she may not be on the stage anymore, she is still the leader of this troupe behind the curtains.
It is not what we desired, but for now she's content being our shadow leader.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Some big wig from the castle wants to speak with us, supposedly.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Oh, really?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Are you sure it's not just a fan trying to get our attention?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: A person of great importance, they said.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No one who is actually of great importance would ever refer to themselves as such. How suspicious.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I thought the same, but they just won't go away. They said my whole family would be beheaded unless I bring the people in charge to them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: They can do that?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're working backstage, Olivia. The only ones they have to see are me and Kiki.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Uh, they kind of asked for the leader, specifically.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: For Olivia, you mean?
We exchange slightly alarmed glances.
Olivia is no longer working here in any official capacity, so if they requested her by name...
It might be someone we know.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Wanna go see what this is all about?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes. Let's go see who they are. Perhaps they are as important as they claim, after all.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: This way.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Err... Ah! There they are. Look, by the entrance.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Wait a minute...
Olivia looks up at me, and I notice the anxiousness in her gaze.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's Queen Elizabeth's attendant...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? The queen?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's go.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Well met. It has been far too long, William Shakespeare and Olivia Berry.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: No need to look so tense! I am merely a theatergoer today.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: O-Okay?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whoa, the queen brings her whole throne with her when she goes on escapades? Isn't it a bit... big?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I don't think she'd be able to move about in secrecy if that's the case.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Y-You're gonna get us killed! Shut it!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I grow restless if I'm not sat on my throne, so I secretly had it brought here to this theater of yours.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I didn't even notice...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Visiting theaters in secret is a specialty of mine. There is no theater in this city that I cannot sneak into, throne and all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Th-That's remarkable!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Tonight's comedy was simply sublime, Shakespeare. Truly, your performance elevates the good name of the Lord Chamberlain's Men.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Thank you.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: However... Do you know why I summoned you tonight?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I... honestly have no idea, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Olivia Berry.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, Your Majesty?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You were originally the leader of this troupe, correct?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Yet you don't stand on your own stage now. Why is that?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Because I'm a woman, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Yes. You were allowed to perform for that one night only.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: It is a regrettable state of affairs. I wish to see you perform again, truly I do. But you should know that will never happen during my reign, as much as I may want it to.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Isn't that right, Shakespeare?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Well then, how would you explain to me this member of your troupe?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Why is this woman standing on stage, I ask.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: No response, then?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: N-No, my Queen... She, uh, err, no! He...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You have it wrong, Ma'am. He's actually a man.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Ayup.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Hahah... Ahahah! Ahahahahahah!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Have you lost your mind, Shakespeare? You mean to tell me this beautiful specimen is a man?! Surely you jest!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I have seen many actors in my time, boy, but never have I seen a man like this.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: E-Eheheh.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is no time to blush at compliments, Kiki.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: N-No, Ma'am. This is no jest. He is, in fact, male... biologically, at least.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Ayup.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: So you shall play innocent, then.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, I...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Well, let us play along. Shall I ascertain the sex of this man of yours right here and now?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Err, well... S-Sure? Go ahead?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mhm, mhm.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Good by me!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You underestimate my mettle at your own peril. If you believe your resolute attitude will get me to back down, you are sorely mistaken.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We'd never do such a foolish thing. You are welcome to ascertain as much as you want, Ma'am.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki, makes preparations so Her Majesty can ascertain properly.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Okie dokie! Now, if you'll excuse me...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Upsy daisy! Okay, here goes! Oop!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Wh-What in the world is this?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? Is it hard to see?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: L-Lord preserve! A real appendage! I-It's so imposing too! Goodness!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I told you!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: O-Obviously, you stuffed your underpants! It is fake!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Feel free to touch.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: T-Touch? Me? Touch th-that huge thing?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Feel free to slide your royal hand right in, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Oh my!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Make sure to go all the way down to the base so you can make sure it's properly attached.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: E-Eep!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I call that one the left squire, and that's the right squire.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I-I think the knight is putting on armor!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Ah, yes! Right there, oooh...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: E-E-Enough! I've, err, seen enough! No more!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Hah... Hah... Hah... Haah...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How was it, Ma'am?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I-I reserve my impression, Shakespeare! P-Please, tell Kiki to put it away this instant!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: A respectable reaction.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You heard Her Majesty, Kiki.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Okay!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It's gone now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The knight is gone.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: M-Mhm...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Can we keep employing Kiki as an actor, Ma'am?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I-If he or she or they are indeed male, I see no reason why not!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Thank you for your kind understanding.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Goodie!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: May we go back to the stage?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You may. Um, Kiki...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Your body is a veritable gift from the heavens. You must endeavour to perfect your craft as an actor.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Thank you, Ma'am!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You may go now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: With your permission.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Well then... That was a terrific experience.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: There truly are so many different people in this country of ours.
